description: In an unprecedented step, the U.S. has imposed sanctions in recent months on about a dozen Israelis who it says have taken violent action against Palestinians and posed obstacles to peace. We hear from one Israeli who the U.S. has taken action against.
title: Why is the U.S. Sanctioning Some Israelis?

description: Google and the state of California are paying 250 million dollars over the next five years to California news outlets, and research AI technology they say will assist journalists.
title: Inside the battle between Google and California newsrooms

description: A drug that restores brain metabolism in mouse models of Alzheimer's also improved cognitive function. The discovery could help researchers find additional pathways to combating the symptoms of this brain disease, beyond the telltale amyloid plaques and tau tangles that are hallmarks of Alzheimer's.
title: A drug that restores brain metabolism could help treat Alzheimer's

description: During the summer in Alaska, tourists can find a wintery dog mushing experience on the Norris Glacier near Juneau. A dog sledding camp there helps mushers maintain a steady income during the off-season, and keeps the dogs in running shape.
title: Summertime glacier mushing in Alaska

description: MIT says the percentage of Black, Hispanic, Native American, Pacific Islander students in its incoming freshman class has plummeted, tying it to 2023’s Supreme Court ruling banning affirmative action.
title: The diversity within MIT's enrollment has plummeted

description: The U.S. has imposed sanctions on about a dozen Israelis who it says have taken violent action against Palestinians and posed obstacles to peace. It’s an unprecedented step in the increasingly fraught U.S.-Israel relationship.
title: The U.S. imposes sanctions on some Israelis after violence and obstructions to peace

description: Demand for electricity in Texas continues to break records. It comes as the power grid strains under increased demand due to data centers and cryptocurrency mining.
title: The Texas power grid is straining under data and crypto demands

description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Republican strategist Scott Jennings about his thoughts on the past week at the DNC.
title: GOP strategist shares his thoughts on the DNC thus far

description: For six of the 10 drugs that Medicare negotiated to lower prices, the net prices aren't any better than the ones insurers already get. But there may be a change in patients' choices of medicines.
title: Medicare negotiated lower prices on several drugs. What does that mean for patients?

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks to Regina Barber and Emily Kwong of NPR's Short Wave about an ancient magma ocean on the moon, the snake problem of Florida's Everglades, and why scrolling through video clips bores us.
title: This week's Short Wave news roundup

description: Ahead of the new school year, the University of California system, one of the largest in the nation, has updated its policies around campus protests and encampments.
title: How the UC system has updated it's protest policies

description: Uncommitted voters are angry that they have so far been denied a speaking slot at the DNC. It has been a discordant note in an otherwise celebratory event.
title: Uncommitted voters share their thoughts at the DNC

description: The Harris/Walz ticket will need to make inroads typically Republican states, counties, and districts. So, how can Democrats flip these red areas? NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with strategists and rural delegates at the DNC about how Democrats can win these voters in 2024.
title: How blue candidates win in red districts

description: The fate of TikTok in the U.S. will be determined by a high-stakes court hearing set for September. But TikTok is demanding the government turn over its classified documents on the app.
title: Court to decide who can see secret evidence U.S. has filed against TikTok

description: The Gen-Z Congressman from Florida will be speaking on the final night of the Democratic National Convention.
title: The first Gen Z elected to Congress, Maxwell Frost, will speak at the DNC tonight

description: The U.S. Supreme Court has for now granted a Republican request to require Arizona voters to submit proof of their U.S. citizenship when using the state’s registration form.
title: Supreme Court grants GOP bid to require citizenship proof for some Arizona voters

description: How much sway do stars really have when it comes to putting the next President in the White House?
title: Everyone wants Taylor Swift's vote. But celebrity endorsements are complicated.

description: The Chicks — formerly known as The Dixie Chicks — will sing “The Star Spangled Banner” at the Democratic National Convention Thursday night. That performance, and the group’s presence, will provide the latest chapter in The Chicks’ long and complicated political history.
title: When The Chicks perform the National Anthem tonight at the DNC, they’ll bring a complicated history

description: Georgetown professor Daniel Byman discusses Ukraine’s daring offensive into Russian territory. And he reflects on the future of Gaza, after Israel’s military operation ends.
title: Foreign policy analyst weighs in on two critical conflict zones: Ukraine and Gaza

description: A week of rallying will end with a speech from the presidential nominee herself, Kamala Harris.
title: Here’s who’s speaking on the final night of the DNC

description: Strong human emotions — love and pride — shone on the national political stage, as 17-year-old Gus and Tim Walz shared a heart-warming moment.
title: Gus and Tim Walz share a father-son moment that melts hearts of people watching the DNC

description: The residents of Thulasendrapuram in southern India are rooting for Kamala Harris, whose maternal grandfather lived in the village a century ago. They've organized prayers for her in the local temple.
title: In Kamala Harris' ancestral village in India, people cheer her U.S. presidential bid

description: As Democrats wrap their third night in Chicago, the Democratic National Convention continues its message of freedom and readies itself for its final night: the speech from Vice President Harris.
title: 6 takeaways (so far) from the Democratic National Convention

description: Tim Walz stepped into the spotlight last night at the DNC giving the crowd a pep talk. Here are five other takeaways from the convention so far. And, new COVID-19 vaccines are on the way.
title: Not Joe Biden’s DNC: 6 takeaways so far. Plus, new COVID-19 vaccines on the way

description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Ali Krieger, former U.S. Women's National Team star, about the new collective bargaining agreement between players and the National Women's Soccer League.
title: National Women’s Soccer League and its players agree to a new contract deal

description: The possibility of a Canadian company buying 7-Eleven is sure to attract the attention of the government, investors and consumers in Japan, where the convenience chain is a staple of everyday life.
title: Canadian company Alimentation Couche-Tard offers to buy the parent of 7-Eleven

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Joe Brusuelas, chief economist at accounting firm RSM US, about the economic plans of presidential candidates Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.
title: Both major presidential campaigns indicate a desire to expand the child tax credit

description: Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz introduced himself to the nation in a primetime address at the convention. Kamala Harris will give the convention's keynote address on Thursday night.
title: All eyes at the DNC turn to Harris for her turn to address delegates

description: Hundreds of products failed to reach adequate recommendations for macronutrients like protein and calories, but exceeded the recommended sugar content.
title: Nearly 60% of baby foods in the U.S. don't meet nutritional guidelines, study says

description: Former President Donald Trump's rallies often resemble rock concerts, full of his greatest hits. But the former president has struggled to change his tune to run against Vice President Harris.
title: Trump's remixed rallies try to change the tune from 'Crooked Joe' to 'Comrade Kamala'

description: An example of how journalism sometimes works: a team investigates one story, one narrative, and if they keep an open mind and dig into the facts, they discover the real story is entirely different.
title: Investigating the story of a prominent Chinese dissent turned con artist

description: Climate change and energy policy is slated to be one of the topics that Democrats focus on as they make their pitch to mobilize the party for Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Climate change to get its moment in the sun at Democratic convention on Thursday

description: Community college is often touted as an affordable start for students who want to earn bachelor’s degrees. But according to federal data, only 13% of students actually reach that goal.
title: Most community college students plan to get 4-year degrees. Few actually do

description: While Night 3 of the DNC was capped with Tim Walz accepting the vice presidential nomination, there were a few other twists along the way — from Oprah to Stevie Wonder and more Republicans.
title: Who spoke at the DNC: Watch speeches from Tim Walz, Bill Clinton, Oprah and Stevie Wonder

description: Tim Walz accepted the Democratic Party’s vice presidential nomination tonight in Chicago, closing out a slate of speakers that included Oprah Winfrey and former President Bill Clinton.
title: Tim Walz headlines third night of DNC with help from Clinton, Oprah and Stevie Wonder

description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg addressed the DNC on night 3 in advance of VP nominee Tim Walz.
title: Pete Buttigieg calls for 'joy' — not a 're-run of some TV wresting death match'

description: Maryland's governor takes a Trump deferment jab.
title: WATCH: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore addresses the Democratic National Convention

description: Oprah Winfrey, the media mogul and influential talk show host, gave a thunderous speech endorsing the Harris-Walz campaign on Wednesday night.
title: WATCH: Oprah Winfrey addresses the Democratic National Convention

description: National Youth Poet Laureate Amanda Gorman delivered a poem to rouse the audience in celebration of Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: WATCH: Amanda Gorman brought passion through poetry to Night 3 of the DNC

description: Former President Bill Clinton spoke to the crowd on Night 3 of the DNC, thanking President Biden for his service, praising Kamala Harris and emphasizing the high stakes of the November election.
title: WATCH: Former President Bill Clinton rallies the crowd around 'clear choice' in November

description: Actress Mindy Kaling jokes about 'outing' Kamala Harris as Indian Actress Mindy Kaling addressed the Democratic National Convention, sharing anecdotes of her and Vice President Harris’ similar Indian backgrounds.
title: Actress Mindy Kaling jokes about 'outing' Kamala Harris as Indian at Night 3 of the DNC

description: The event, billed as focused on national security issues, was part of former President Trump's weeklong series of counterprogramming to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
title: Trump speaks behind bulletproof glass at 1st outdoor rally since attempted assassination

description: As the DNC gets underway for the third night, protesters gathered in Union Park, a few blocks away from the United Center.
title: Pro-Palestinian protesters rally outside the Democratic National Convention
